text: The Blue Mountains hold ancient wisdom - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Iyah
When the drums speak, spirits listen - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Nyahbinghi
The coconut tree teaches resilience - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Maroon
In the herb garden, healing grows - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder I-tal
The sea breeze carries our prayers - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Zion
When the rain falls, blessings flow - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Kumina
The bamboo sways with wisdom - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Revival
In the coffee fields, strength grows - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Accompong
The hummingbird brings joy - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Pocomania
When the sun rises, hope awakens - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Rasta
The mango tree shares its sweetness - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Obeah
In the river's flow, we find peace - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Burru
The banana leaf teaches flexibility - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Etu
When the wind blows, spirits dance - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Myal
The breadfruit feeds body and soul - Jamaican Oral Traditions - Elder Nanny
